Response: NA; we didn't have any changes

Through the system-wide transitions of care program, we have embedded transitions of care nurses in all the medical centers. We have also created a process to ensure all bpci advanced patients are identified and connected to the right resource. Finally, we developed a team of post acute care liaisons to follow patients, support warm hand-offs/transitions after the inpatient discharge.

Some successes include: increasing awareness of value based care programs across the organization and improving operational integration and coordination among various clinical departments. Some challenges include: short time frame to analyze large quantities of data and some of the attribution overlap with various CMS value based care programs (CJR and ACO).
We had a system-wide Epic implementation for all the hospitals in 2018.
There have been no material challenges.

Positive outcomes include increased engagement with the claims based bundles data. Negative outcomes include tension between providers with overlapping CMS value based care programs.

AHS has a means to audit and monitor internal systems and activities in order to verify compliance.  Regular audits are performed in accordance with a formal workplan.  Each year the audit workplan is developed in response to its risk assessment.  The workplan is created using a multi-disciplinary collaboration.
